scenario_name: CareConnect Squad Sprint 7 Planning (Patient Portal Enhancements)
company_context: Nimbus Health is a mid‑size digital health platform (≈350 employees) focused on patient‑centric tools. The CareConnect Squad builds the web‑based Patient Portal used by ~200k patients to view appointments, labs, and medication information. The squad reports to the Product Management org for the Patient Experience product line.
meeting_event_details:
Date: Monday, 14 Oct 2025
Time: 09:00 – 10:30 PT (90 min)
Location: Zoom meeting (ID: 842‑923‑571) + physical room "Blue‑3" at Nimbus HQ, San Francisco (for on‑site members).
Agenda: Review backlog, finalize sprint goal, confirm capacity, surface dependencies/blockers, and agree on Definition of Done.
stakeholders: Aisha Patel – Product Manager (CareConnect Squad) – owns sprint goal, prioritisation, and stakeholder communication.
Ravi Kumar – Lead Front‑End Engineer – responsible for UI implementation and integration with API v3.
Leila Chen – Back‑End Engineer – owns API contract and data‑privacy compliance checks.
Megan O'Neill – UX/UI Designer – delivers high‑fidelity mockups and design specs.
Javier Torres – QA Lead – creates test strategy, automates regression suites, and validates acceptance criteria.
Samir Gupta – DevOps Engineer – ensures CI/CD pipeline readiness and staging environment stability.
Elena Rossi – Legal & Compliance Analyst – reviews notification content for HIPAA/PHI compliance.
Tom Whitaker – Engineering Manager – tracks capacity, removes impediments, and approves overtime budget.
deliverables: Sprint backlog in Jira with 12 user stories (total 68 story points) and clear acceptance criteria.
Sprint Goal: "Enable patients to self‑service appointment changes and receive timely lab result notifications while improving medication list usability."
High‑fidelity mockups for the new Appointment Reschedule flow and Medication List redesign (Figma links).
Updated API contract (OpenAPI spec) for Lab Results Notification endpoint (v3).
Test plan document covering functional, regression, and performance tests for all stories.
Definition of Done checklist signed off by all squad members.
Draft release notes template for the upcoming production deployment.
success_criteria: At least 10 of the 12 planned stories (≥80 % of story points) reach Done by sprint end.
Zero critical or high‑severity bugs escape to production.
Lab Results Notification passes performance test: <200 ms latency for 1,000 concurrent users.
User‑experience rating from internal beta testers ≥4.5/5 for the new Appointment Reschedule flow.
Legal sign‑off on notification content obtained no later than 20 Oct 2025.
constraints: Budget allows a maximum of 8 overtime hours per engineer for the sprint (approved by Engineering Manager).
API v3 delivery from the Core Services team is a hard dependency; must be merged by 18 Oct 2025.
HIPAA compliance review must be completed before any code touching PHI is merged to main.
Design assets must be finalised 2 business days before development starts (by 16 Oct 2025).
Sprint length is fixed at 2 weeks (14 Oct – 27 Oct 2025) due to quarterly release cadence.
workback_prompt: Create a detailed workback plan for Nimbus Health's CareConnect Squad Sprint 7 (14 Oct – 27 Oct 2025). Include all tasks needed to deliver the sprint goal, assign owners, estimate effort, identify critical path items, and map each deliverable to the success criteria and constraints listed in the scenario. Output the plan as a table with columns: Task, Owner, Estimated Effort (hours), Start Date, End Date, Dependencies, Success Metric Alignment.
